form.longName: PhenX PX120101 - General Psychiatric Assessment Adult
form.preferredDefinition: The Composite International Diagnostic Interview - Short Form (CIDI-SF) is an interviewer administered questionnaire that screens adults for the presence of depression, generalized anxiety, specific phobia, social phobia, agoraphobia, panic attack, obsessive compulsive disorder and personality disorders. Scoring information is also provided.

question.questionText: A1a. Have you ever had a time in your life when you felt sad, blue, or depressed for two weeks or more in a row? (depression_two_weeks_lifetime)
A1b. Have you ever had a time in your life lasting two weeks or more when you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure? (depression_lost_interest)
Please think of the twoweek period in your life when your feelings of depression or loss of interest were worst: (inst2_012001)
A1c. How much of the day did these feeling usually last? (depression_day_length)

validValue.meaningText: Less than half of the day
validValue.description: Less than half of the day

question.questionText: A1d. Did you feel this way: (depression_how_often)
A2. Did you feel more tired out or low on energy than is usual for you? (depression_tired)
A3. Did you gain or lose weight without trying, or did you stay about the same weight? (depression_weight_change)

validValue.meaningText: Stayed about the same or on a diet
validValue.description: Stayed about the same or on a diet

question.questionText: A3aa. About how much weight did you gain? (depression_weight_gain)
A3ab. About how much weight did you lose? (depression_weight_loss)
A3ac. About how much weight did you gain when gain and lose? (depression_weight_gain_loss)
3ac. About how much weight did you lose when gain and loose? (depression_weight_gai2_417)
A4. Did you have more trouble falling asleep than you usually do? (depression_trouble_sleeping)
A4a. How often did that happen? (depression_trouble_sleeping_frequency)
A5. Did you have a lot more trouble concentrating than usual? (depression_trouble_concentrating)
A6. People sometimes feel down on themselves, no good, or worthless. Did you feel this way? (depression_feel_worthless)
A7. Did you think a lot about death either your own, someone else's, or death in general? (depression_thoughts_of_death)

A8. About how many weeks altogether did you feel this way? Count the weeks before, during and after the worst two weeks. The total period of depression/loss of interest was: (depression_number_periods_twoweeks)
A8a. How many periods like this did you have in your life, lasting two or more weeks? (depression_number_weeks)
A8b. About how old were you the FIRST time you had a period of two weeks like this? (Whether or not you received any help for it.) (depression_age_onset)
A8c. About how old were you the LAST time you had a period of two weeks like this? (Whether or not you received any help for it.) (depression_age_last_occurrence)
A8d. Did you ever tell a professional about these problems (medical doctor, psychologist, social worker, counselor, nurse, clergy, or other helping professional)? (depression_tell_professional)
A8e. Did you take medication or use drugs or alcohol more than once for these problems? (depression_medication)
A8f. How much did these problems interfere with your life or activities: (depression_interfere_activities)
B1. Have you ever had a period lasting one month or longer when most of the time you felt worried, tense, or anxious? (gad_worried_two_weeks)
B1a. People differ a lot in how much they worry about things. Did you ever have a time when you worried a lot more than most people would in your situation? (gad_worried_more_than_others)
B2. What is the longest period of time that this kind of worrying has ever continued? (Years) (gad_longest_time_worried_years)
B2. What is the longest period of time that this kind of worrying has ever continued? (Months) (gad_longest_time_worried_months)
B2. What is the longest period of time that this kind of worrying has ever continued? (gad_longest_time_worried_always)

validValue.meaningText: all of my life/as long as I can remember
validValue.description: all of my life/as long as I can remember

question.questionText: B4. During that period, was your worry stronger than in other people? (gad_longest_period_stronger_worry)
B5. Did you worry most days? (gad_worry_most_days)
B6. Did you usually worry about one particular thing, such as your job security or the failing health of a loved one, or more than one thing? (gad_worry_one_particular_thing)
B7. Did you find it difficult to stop worrying? (gad_difficult_stop_worry)
B8. Did you ever have different worries on your mind at the same time? (gad_different_worries_same_time)
B9. How often was your worry so strong that you couldn't put it out of your mind no matter how hard you tried? (gad_worry_constantly_on_mind)
B10. How often did you find it difficult to control your worry? (gad_difficult_control_worry)
B12. When you were worried or anxious, were you also: (b12inst_0120101)
B12a. Restless? (gad_also_restless)
B12b. Keyed up or on edge? (gad_also_on_edge)
B12c. Easily tired? (gad_also_easily_tired)
B12d. Having difficulty keeping your mind on what you were doing? (gad_also_difficulty_concentrating)
B12e. More irritable than usual? (gad_also_irritable)
B12f. Having tense, sore, or aching muscles? (gad_also_tense)
B12g. Often having trouble falling or staying asleep? (gad_also_trouble_sleeping)
B14. Did you ever tell a professional about these problems (medical doctor, psychologist, social worker, counselor, nurse, clergy, or other helping professional)? (gad_tell_professional)
B15. Did you take medication or use drugs or alcohol more than once for the worry or the problems it was causing? (gad_take_medication)
B16. How much did the worry or anxiety interfere with your life or activities? (gad_interfere_activities)

C1. The next questions are about things that make some people so afraid that they avoid them, even when there is no real danger. Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following things: (instc_0120101)
C1a. Heights, storms, thunder, lightning, or being in still water, like a swimming pool or lakes? (specific_water)
C1b.Being in a closed space like a cave, tunnel, elevator, or airplane? (specific_enclosed_space)
C1c. Snakes, birds, rats, bugs, or other animals? (specific_animals)
C1d. Seeing blood, getting a shot or injection, seeing a dentist, or going to a hospital? (specific_blood)
C1a. Heights, storms, thunder, lightning, or being in still water, like a swimming pool or lakes: (c1aheader_0120101)
C2. How often do you get upset when you are in that situation? (specific_how_often_upset)

validValue.meaningText: Only one or two times ever
validValue.description: Only one or two times ever

question.questionText: C4. How long have you had any of these fears? (specific_how_long)
C4. How long have you had any of these fears? (if less than one year, enter number of months) (specific_how_long_months)
C5. How much have any of these fears ever interfered with your life or activities? (specific_interfere_activities)
C6. Have you ever been very upset with yourself for having any of these fears? (specific_upset_with_self)
C7. Is your fear unreasonable that is, much stronger than it should be? (specific_fear_unreasonable)
C8. Is your fear much stronger than in other people? (specific_fear_stronger_thanothers_water)
C1b.Being in a closed space like a cave, tunnel, elevator, or airplane: (c1bheader_0120101)
C2. How often do you get upset when you are in that situation? (specific_how_often_up2_ed7)

validValue.meaningText: Only one or two times ever
validValue.description: Only one or two times ever

question.questionText: C4. How long have you had any of these fears? (specific_how_long2_8c5)
C4. How long have you had any of these fears? (if less than one year, enter number of months) (specific_how_long_mon2_a7c)
C5. How much have any of these fears ever interfered with your life or activities? (specific_interfere_ac2_5ec)
C6. Have you ever been very upset with yourself for having any of these fears? (specific_upset_with_s2_1a5)
C7. Is your fear unreasonable that is, much stronger than it should be? (specific_fear_unreaso2_818)
C8. Is your fear much stronger than in other people? (specific_fear_stronge2_0b8)
C1c. Snakes, birds, rats, bugs, or other animals: (c1cheader_0120101)
C2. How often do you get upset when you are in that situation? (specific_how_often_up2_508)

validValue.meaningText: Only one or two times ever
validValue.description: Only one or two times ever

C1d. Seeing blood, getting a shot or injection, seeing a dentist, or going to a hospital: (c1dheader_0120101)
C2. How often do you get upset when you are in that situation? (specific_how_often_up2_e1d)

validValue.meaningText: Only one or two times ever
validValue.description: Only one or two times ever

C4. How long have you had any of these fears? (if less than one year, enter number of months) (specific_how_long_mon2_c5c)
C5. How much have any of these fears ever interfered with your life or activities? (specific_interfere_ac2_8be)

D1. Here's another list of situations that can cause unreasonably strong fears. They involve doing things in front of other people or being the center of attention. Do you have an unreasonably strong fear or avoid any of the following situations: (instd_0120101)
D1a. Giving a speech or speaking in public? (social_speech)
D1b. Eating or drinking where someone could watch you? (social_public_drinking)
D1c. Talking to people because you might have nothing to say or might sound foolish? (social_sound_foolish)
D1d. Writing while someone watches? (social_writing)
D1e. Taking part or speaking in a meeting or class? (social_speaking_class_meeting)
D1f. Going to a party or other social outing? (social_party)
D1a. Giving a speech or speaking in public: (d1aheader_0120101)
D2. How often do you get very upset when you are in this situation? (social_how_often_upset)

validValue.meaningText: Only one or two times ever
validValue.description: Only one or two times ever

D3. How long have you had any of these fears? (# of months) (social_how_long_hadfears_months)
D4. How much have any of these fears ever interfered with your life or activities? (social_fears_interfere_activities)
D5. Have you ever been very upset with yourself for having any of these fears? (social_upset_with_self)
D6. Is your fear unreasonable that is, much stronger than it should be? (social_unreasonable)
D7. Is your fear much stronger than in other people? (social_fear_stronger_than_others)
D1b. Eating or drinking where someone could watch you: (d1bheader_0120101)
D2. How often do you get very upset when you are in this situation? (social_how_often_upse2_477)

E1. Here's a final list of situations that can cause unreasonably strong fears. Do you have an unreasonably strong fear for or avoid any of the following: (inste1_0120101)
E1a. Being in a crowd or standing in line? (agoraphobia_crowd)
E1b. Being away from home alone? (agoraphobia_away_from_home)
E1c. Traveling alone? (agoraphobia_travelling_alone)
E1d. Traveling in a bus, train, or car? (agoraphobia_bus_car_train)
E1e. Being in a public place like a department store? (agoraphobia_public_place)
E1a. Being in a crowd or standing in line: (e1ah_0120101)
E2. How often do you get very upset in the situation? (agoraphobia_how_often_upset)

validValue.meaningText: Only one or two times ever
validValue.description: Only one or two times ever

question.questionText: E4. How long have you had any of these fears? (agoraphobia_how_long_had_fears)
E4. How long have you had any of these fears? (# of months) (agoraphobia_howlong_had_fears_months)
E5. Were you ever afraid that you might faint, lose control, or embarrass yourself in other ways? (agoraphobia_faint_embarrass)
E6. Do you worry that you might be trapped without any way to escape? (agoraphobia_trapped2_ec0)
E7. Do you worry that help might not be available if you needed it? (agoraphobia_no_help)
E8. How much did any of these fears ever interfere with your life or activities? (agoraphobia_interfere_with_activities)
E1b. Being away from home alone: (e1bh_0120101)
E2. How often do you get very upset in the situation? (agoraphobia_how_often2_4b0)

validValue.meaningText: Only one or two times ever
validValue.description: Only one or two times ever

question.questionText: E4. How long have you had any of these fears? (agoraphobia_how_long_2_eb5)

F1. Did you ever have a spell or an attack when all of a sudden you felt frightened, anxious, or very uneasy? (panic_attack)
F1a. Did any of these attacks occur when you were in a lifethreatening situation? (panic_during_life_threatening_situations)
F1b. Did any of these attacks occur when you were not in a lifethreatening situation? (panic_during_nonlife_threatening_situations)
F2. About how many attacks have you had in your life? (panic_number_attacks)
F3. How long ago did you have the most recent attack? (panic_occurrence_most_recent_attack)
F4. Did some of your attacks happen in a situation when you were not in danger or not the center of attention? (panic_occur_not_center_of_attention)

F5. We already asked about specific situations that cause unreasonably strong fears (heights, elevators, snakes, etc.). When you have sudden anxiety attacks, do they usually occur in specific situations that cause you unreasonably strong fear? (panic_specific_situations)
F5a.. Did you ever have an attack when you were not in a situation that usually causes you to have unreasonably strong fears? (panic_attack_random)
F6. When you have attacks: (f6inst_0120101)
F6a. Does your heart pound or race? (panic_heart_race)
F6b. Do you have tightness, pain, or discomfort in your chest or stomach? (panic_chest_stomach_pain)
F6c. Do you sweat? (panic_sweat)
F6d. Do you tremble or shake? (panic_shake)
F6e. Do you have hot flashes or chills? (panic_hot_flashes_chills)
F6f. Do you, or things around you, seem unreal? (panic_things_seem_unreal)

I1. Have you ever been bothered by having certain unpleasant thoughts of your own that kept entering your mind against your wishes? An example would be if you kept having the idea that your hands are dirty or have germs on them. (ocd_unpleasant_thoughts_germs)

I2. Another example of an unpleasant thought would if you kept having the idea that you might harm someone, even though you really didn't want to. Or you might have had thoughts you were ashamed of, but couldn't keep out of your mind. Have you ever had any unpleasant and persistent thoughts like that? (ocd_thoughts_harm_ashamed)
Please think about the time in your life when some of these unpleasant thoughts were bothering you the most. (desci_0120101)
I3. Did some of these thoughts seem to you to be unreasonable? (ocd_thoughts_seem_unreasonable)
I4. Did these thoughts keep coming back again and again into your mind no matter how hard you tried to resist, ignore, or get rid of them? (ocd_thoughts_keep_coming_back)
I5. Did you ever tell a doctor about these thoughts? (ocd_tell_professional_about_thoughts)
I6. Did thinking about these ideas interfere with your life or work, or cause you difficulty with your relatives or friends, or upset you a great deal? (ocd_thoughts_interfere_activities)

I7. Some people have the unpleasant feeling that they have to do something over and over again even though they know it is foolish, but they can't resist doing it things like washing their hands again and again or going back several times to be sure they've locked a door or turned off the stove. Have you ever had to do something like that over and over? (ocd_repeat_actions)
I8. Was there a time when you felt you had to do something in a certain order, like getting dressed perhaps, and had to start all over again if you did it in the wrong order? (ocd_certain_order)
I9. Has there been a period of several weeks when you felt you had to count something, like the squares in a tile floor, and couldn't resist doing it even when you tried to? (ocd_counting)
I10. Did you have a period when you had to say certain words over and over, either aloud or to yourself? (ocd_repeat_words)
I13. Did you think that these actions were unnecessary or that you overdid it? (ocd_think_actions_unnecessary)

instruction.text: [ocd_thoughts_seem_unreasonable] = '1' or [ocd_thoughts_keep_coming_back] = '1' or [ocd_tell_professional_about_thoughts] = '1' or [ocd_thoughts_interfere_activities] = '1' or [ocd_repeat_actions] = '1' or [ocd_repeat_actions] = '1' or [ocd_ce..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: I14. Did you tell a doctor about having to do these things? (ocd_tell_professional_about_actions)

instruction.text: [ocd_thoughts_seem_unreasonable] = '1' or [ocd_thoughts_keep_coming_back] = '1' or [ocd_tell_professional_about_thoughts] = '1' or [ocd_thoughts_interfere_activities] = '1' or [ocd_repeat_actions] = '1' or [ocd_repeat_actions] = '1' or [ocd_ce..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: I15. Did having to do these things interfere with your life or work, or cause you difficulty with your relatives or friends, or upset you a great deal? (ocd_actions_interfere_activities)

instruction.text: [ocd_thoughts_seem_unreasonable] = '1' or [ocd_thoughts_keep_coming_back] = '1' or [ocd_tell_professional_about_thoughts] = '1' or [ocd_thoughts_interfere_activities] = '1' or [ocd_repeat_actions] = '1' or [ocd_repeat_actions] = '1' or [ocd_ce..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Have you ever received treatment for, or been diagnosed with, any of the following conditions: (mdec_0120001)
M1a. Schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder (m_schizophrenia_treatment_diagnosis)
M1b. Hearing voices others could not hear or believing things that others said were not true (such as that people were trying to harm you) (m_hearing_voices_treatment_diagnosis)
M1c. Bipolar disorder (manicdepression) (m_bipolar_treatment_diagnosis)

On the following questions, you will be asked a series of questions that may or may not describe you. Please answer each question by indicating 'YES or 'NO'. There are no right or wrong answers, and no trick questions. Work quickly and do not think too long about the exact meaning of the questions. (kinst_0120101)
K1. Does your mood often go up and down? (personality_up_down)
K2. Do you ever feel 'just miserable' for no reason? (personality_miserable)
K3. Are you an irritable person? (personality_irritable)
K4. Are your feelings easily hurt? (personality_feelings_easily_hurt)
K5. Do you often feel 'fedup? (personality_feel_fed_up)
K6. Would you call yourself a nervous person? (personality_nervous)
K7. Are you a worrier? (personality_worrier)
K8. Would you call yourself tense or 'highlystrung'? (personality_high_strung)
K9. Do you worry too long after an embarrassing experience? (personality_worry_embarrassing_experience)
K10. Do you suffer from 'nerves'? (personality_nerves)
K11. Do you often feel lonely? (personality_lonely)
K12. Are you often troubled about feelings of guilt? (personality_guilt)
K13. Are you a talkative person? (personality_talkative)
K14. Are you rather lively? (personality_lively)
K15. Do you enjoy meeting new people? (personality_enjoy_meeting)
K16. Can you usually let yourself go and enjoy yourself at a lively party? (personality_let_yourself_go)
K17. Do you usually take the initiative in making new friends? (personality_make_new_friends)
K18. Can you easily get some life into a rather dull party? (personality_life_of_party)
K19. Do you tend to keep in the background on social occasions? (personality_background_social_occasions)
K20. Do you like mixing with people? (personality_mixing_with_people)
K21. Do you like plenty of bustle and excitement around you? (personality_enjoy_excitement)
K22. Are you mostly quiet when you are with other people? (personality_quiet_around_others)
K23. Do other people think of you as being very lively? (personality_people_consider_me_lively)
K24. Can you get a party going? (personality_get_party_going)

Please see scoring information in the following pdf: "https://www.phenxtoolkit.org/toolkit_content/supplemental_info/psychiatric/additional_info/CIDI_SF_scoring.pdf" CIDI Scoring Information (scoring_0120101)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Composite International Diagnostic Interview - Short Form (CIDI-SF) is an interviewer administered questionnaire that screens adults for the presence of depression, generalized anxiety, specific phobia, social phobia, agoraphobia, panic attack, obsessive compulsive disorder and personality disorders. Scoring information is also provided.
